section: This Website Design, Development and Hosting Agreement the ("Agreement") is entered into on January 11, 2018 by and between Natalija Tunevic, director of FreeCook (hereinafter referred to as "Client") and Mitchell Vitalis, director of Mitchell's Web Advance, PLC (hereinafter referred to as "Service Provider").
explanation: The agreement initially defines the client as Natalija Tunevic, 'director of FreeCook.' However, Natalija Tunevic is signing on behalf of 'Client' but as an individual, not as an agent of FreeCook, as denoted in the signature block. Therefore, if the client is supposed to be FreeCook, then there is a structural flaw as the agreement is structured between the named parties.

section: Service Provider will not make any attempt to proof read or correct any contextual, grammatical or typographical errors in the written content submitted by Client. It is Client's sole responsibility to check the accuracy of the written content and correct any errors prior to submission for final publication. Entity will assume that all the written content submitted by Client has been proofread and is ready for publication.
explanation: The term used is 'Service Provider' but in the third sentence the term 'Entity' is used. This misaligned terminology leads to confusion about which party is responsible for assuming the written content is proofread.

section: Service Provider, either directly or through its authorized vendor, shall provide customer support (the "Customer Support") relating to Client Website consisting of replying to customer questions or complaints regarding website hosting services during the normal business hours set forth.
explanation: The contract states the 'Service Provider' will provide support relating to the 'Client Website'. The subsequent sentence reads: 'Company is not obligated to provide any Customer Service except as specified in this Section'. Because the terminology is not consistent ('Service Provider' vs. 'Company'), the parties have misaligned obligations as 'Company' is never defined. This creates an internal contradiction as one sentence implies an obligation for the service provider, while the following sentence claims the company has no obligation
